FuncDef:
The ike sa nat-keepalive-timer interval command configures the interval for ISAKMP SA to send NAT update packets.
The undo ike sa nat-keepalive-timer interval command restores the default setting.
By default, the interval for the IKE to send NAT update packets is 20 seconds.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the interval for ISAKMP SA to send NAT update packets.
It is an integer that ranges from 5 to 300, in seconds.

ExtraInfo: The NAT peer periodically sends NAT-Keepalive packets to ensure that the security channel is in active state.
